conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles from points A, B, C, and D.
Liquid flows downward from point A.
Liquid from point A encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point A flows into container E.
Liquid flows downward from point B.
Liquid from point B encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point B flows into container E.
Liquid flows downward from point C.
Liquid from point C encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point C flows into container F.
Liquid flows downward from point D.
Liquid from point D encounters a horizontal baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point D flows into container F.
Liquid from points A and B flows into container E.
Liquid from points C and D flows into container F.
Container G will not receive any liquid.
